tex:group: parskip .5pt plus 1pt minus 1pt XLingPapertempdimXLingPaperbulletlistitemwidth+leftskipXLingPapertempdiminterlinepenalty10000XLingPaperbulletlistitemwidth•Both may be installedXLingPapertempdimXLingPaperbulletlistitemwidth+leftskipXLingPapertempdiminterlinepenalty10000XLingPaperbulletlistitemwidth•They use different data directories.XLingPapertempdimXLingPaperbulletlistitemwidth+leftskipXLingPapertempdiminterlinepenalty10000XLingPaperbulletlistitemwidth•My Paratext Projects (Paratext 7)XLingPapertempdimXLingPaperbulletlistitemwidth+leftskipXLingPapertempdiminterlinepenalty10000XLingPaperbulletlistitemwidth•My Paratext 8 Projects (Paratext 8)XLingPapertempdimXLingPaperbulletlistitemwidth+leftskipXLingPapertempdiminterlinepenalty10000XLingPaperbulletlistitemwidth•They use different data servers

tex:cmd.tex:parm: What are you going to do?

tex:cmd.name: XLingPaperblockquote
tex:cmd.tex:parm: Note: you do not need to uninstall Paratext 7 or earlier. But you may need to uninstall and earlier version of Paratext 8.

tex:group: parskip .5pt plus 1pt minus 1pt XLingPapertempdimXLingPaperbulletlistitemwidth+leftskipXLingPapertempdiminterlinepenalty10000XLingPaperbulletlistitemwidth•Double-click on the installer file.XLingPapertempdimXLingPaperbulletlistitemwidth+leftskipXLingPapertempdiminterlinepenalty10000XLingPaperbulletlistitemwidth•After you agree to the license terms, click textbfInstall.textitThis step might take a few minutes if the installer needs to install the .NET 4.5 Framework on your computer.XLingPapertempdimXLingPaperbulletlistitemwidth+leftskipXLingPapertempdiminterlinepenalty10000XLingPaperbulletlistitemwidth•If a dialog appears and asks for your permission, click textbfYes or provide the credentials as required.textit***The Destination Folder step appears. Accept the defaults for the folder.

tex:cmd.name: XLingPaperblockquote
tex:cmd.tex:parm: Note: Paratext 8 data may not share the same directory as Paratext 7 data.

tex:cmd.name: XLingPaperblockquote
tex:cmd.tex:parm: N.B. Les projets de Paratext 8 ne peuvent pas partager le même dossier que les projets de Paratext 7.

tex:group: parskip .5pt plus 1pt minus 1pt XLingPapertempdimXLingPaperbulletlistitemwidth+leftskipXLingPapertempdiminterlinepenalty10000XLingPaperbulletlistitemwidth•Click textbfFinish and then textbfClose.XLingPapertempdimXLingPaperbulletlistitemwidth+leftskipXLingPapertempdiminterlinepenalty10000XLingPaperbulletlistitemwidth•The first time you launch Paratext 8 you will need to enter your Paratext 8 registration code. Information on how to obtain this code is on the Registration page.

tex:cmd.name: noindent
tex:cmd.tex:parm: raiseboxbaselineskip0pthypertargetsRegFirst0pt32.2.2 Register a Paratext 7 user (first time run Paratext) sRegFirsttextbf2.2.2 Register a Paratext 7 user (first time run Paratext)

tex:cmd.tex:parm: Register a Paratext 7 user (first time run Paratext)

tex:cmd.name: XLingPaperblockquote
tex:cmd.tex:parm: All users need a new registration for Paratext 8.

tex:group: parskip .5pt plus 1pt minus 1pt XLingPapertempdimXLingPaperbulletlistitemwidth+leftskipXLingPapertempdiminterlinepenalty10000XLingPaperbulletlistitemwidth•Run Paratext (for the first time)XLingPapertempdimXLingPaperbulletlistitemwidth+leftskipXLingPapertempdiminterlinepenalty10000XLingPaperbulletlistitemwidth•Choose the interface language.textitA dialogue box is displayed asking for your registration code.XLingPapertempdimXLingPaperbulletlistitemwidth+leftskipXLingPapertempdiminterlinepenalty10000XLingPaperbulletlistitemwidth•Go to http://p8.paratext.org/registrationXLingPapertempdimXLingPaperbulletlistitemwidth+leftskipXLingPapertempdiminterlinepenalty10000XLingPaperbulletlistitemwidth•Log-in with a gmail work accountXLingPapertempdimXLingPaperbulletlistitemwidth+leftskipXLingPapertempdiminterlinepenalty10000XLingPaperbulletlistitemwidth•Click on the Register linkXLingPapertempdimXLingPaperbulletlistitemwidth+leftskipXLingPapertempdiminterlinepenalty10000XLingPaperbulletlistitemwidth•Type in the user nameXLingPapertempdimXLingPaperbulletlistitemwidth+leftskipXLingPapertempdiminterlinepenalty10000XLingPaperbulletlistitemwidth•Type in the user’s Paratext 7 registration codeXLingPapertempdimXLingPaperbulletlistitemwidth+leftskipXLingPapertempdiminterlinepenalty10000XLingPaperbulletlistitemwidth•Copy the new codeXLingPapertempdimXLingPaperbulletlistitemwidth+leftskipXLingPapertempdiminterlinepenalty10000XLingPaperbulletlistitemwidth•Return to ParatextXLingPapertempdimXLingPaperbulletlistitemwidth+leftskipXLingPapertempdiminterlinepenalty10000XLingPaperbulletlistitemwidth•Paratext will paste the codetextitParatext is ready for use.

tex:group: parskip .5pt plus 1pt minus 1pt XLingPapertempdimXLingPaperbulletlistitemwidth+leftskipXLingPapertempdiminterlinepenalty10000XLingPaperbulletlistitemwidth•Make sure Paratext is closed.XLingPapertempdimXLingPaperbulletlistitemwidth+leftskipXLingPapertempdiminterlinepenalty10000XLingPaperbulletlistitemwidth•Double-click on the textbfmsp file to install the update.

tex:cmd.name: noindent
tex:cmd.tex:parm: raiseboxbaselineskip0pthypertargetsMDWhere0pt33.1.1 Where We aresMDWheretextbf3.1.1 Where We are

tex:cmd.name: noindent
tex:cmd.tex:parm: raiseboxbaselineskip0pthypertargetsMDWhy0pt33.1.2 Why is this Important ?sMDWhytextbf3.1.2 Why is this Important ?

tex:cmd.tex:parm: What are you going to do?

tex:group: parskip .5pt plus 1pt minus 1pt XLingPapertempdimXLingPaperbulletlistitemwidth+leftskipXLingPapertempdiminterlinepenalty10000XLingPaperbulletlistitemwidth•You must do a send and receive in Paratext 7 from all team members in Paratext 7 prior to migration to Paratext 8.XLingPapertempdimXLingPaperbulletlistitemwidth+leftskipXLingPapertempdiminterlinepenalty10000XLingPaperbulletlistitemwidth•Get the most authoritative data on one computer by doing send and receive between all the computers.XLingPapertempdimXLingPaperbulletlistitemwidth+leftskipXLingPapertempdiminterlinepenalty10000XLingPaperbulletlistitemwidth•One computer on the team initiates the migrationXLingPapertempdimXLingPaperbulletlistitemwidth+leftskipXLingPapertempdiminterlinepenalty10000XLingPaperbulletlistitemwidth•The rest of the team gets the project in Paratext 8 via Send/Receive.XLingPapertempdimXLingPaperbulletlistitemwidth+leftskipXLingPapertempdiminterlinepenalty10000XLingPaperbulletlistitemwidth•Once the project is shared, all team members should only use PT 8 for that project from then on.

parskip .5pt plus 1pt minus 1pt XLingPapertempdimXLingPaperbulletlistitemwidth+leftskipXLingPapertempdiminterlinepenalty10000XLingPaperbulletlistitemwidth•Open the projectXLingPapertempdimXLingPaperbulletlistitemwidth+leftskipXLingPapertempdiminterlinepenalty10000XLingPaperbulletlistitemwidth•Click MigrateXLingPapertempdimXLingPaperbulletlistitemwidth+leftskipXLingPapertempdiminterlinepenalty10000XLingPaperbulletlistitemwidth•***

tex:cmd.name: noindent
tex:cmd.tex:parm: raiseboxbaselineskip0pthypertargetsMigShared0pt33.2.1 Migrate Shared project sMigSharedtextbf3.2.1 Migrate Shared project

tex:cmd.name: noindent
tex:cmd.tex:parm: raiseboxbaselineskip0pthypertargetsPrepMig0pt33.2.2 Prepare a Paratext 7 project for migration Préparer un projet Paratext 7 pour la migrationsPrepMigtextbf3.2.2 Prepare a Paratext 7 project for migration Préparer un projet Paratext 7 pour la migration

tex:cmd.name: markright
tex:cmd.tex:parm: Prepare a Paratext 7 project for migration Préparer un projet Paratext 7 pour la migration

tex:cmd.name: XLingPaperblockquote
tex:cmd.tex:parm: All your users have to migrate at the same time.

tex:group: parskip .5pt plus 1pt minus 1pt XLingPapertempdimXLingPaperbulletlistitemwidth+leftskipXLingPapertempdiminterlinepenalty10000XLingPaperbulletlistitemwidth•All users must do send/receive textbfin Paratext 7 (then cease working in Paratext 7).XLingPapertempdimXLingPaperbulletlistitemwidth+leftskipXLingPapertempdiminterlinepenalty10000XLingPaperbulletlistitemwidth•The Administrator then confirms that the text is in a good state.XLingPapertempdimXLingPaperbulletlistitemwidth+leftskipXLingPapertempdiminterlinepenalty10000XLingPaperbulletlistitemwidth•The Administrator then loads textbfParatext 8.XLingPapertempdimXLingPaperbulletlistitemwidth+leftskipXLingPapertempdiminterlinepenalty10000XLingPaperbulletlistitemwidth•textbfFile > textbfOpen Project/ResourceXLingPapertempdimXLingPaperbulletlistitemwidth+leftskipXLingPapertempdiminterlinepenalty10000XLingPaperbulletlistitemwidth•Click the box at the bottom left to show Paratext 7 projectsXLingPapertempdimXLingPaperbulletlistitemwidth+leftskipXLingPapertempdiminterlinepenalty10000XLingPaperbulletlistitemwidth•0pt "../supimg/image008.jpg" scaled 750XLingPapertempdimXLingPaperbulletlistitemwidth+leftskipXLingPapertempdiminterlinepenalty10000XLingPaperbulletlistitemwidth•Choose the project to migrate.textitIt will likely be described as “v7, unregistered.”

tex:cmd.name: XLingPaperblockquote
tex:cmd.tex:parm: Some active Paratext 7 projects have been registered already for Paratext 8. If yours is one of them, Paratext 8 will show the project as P7 but show it as registered. You can skip the registration step we’ll show you if your project is already registered.

tex:group: parskip .5pt plus 1pt minus 1pt XLingPapertempdimXLingPaperbulletlistitemwidth+leftskipXLingPapertempdiminterlinepenalty10000XLingPaperbulletlistitemwidth•Click textbfOK to start Migrating the Project.textitThe ‘Migrate shared project’ dialog is displayed.0pt "../supimgeng/image003.png" scaled 750 textitParatext 8may tell you the project must be registered (if it is not preregistered) and it must be migrated to Paratext 8.

tex:cmd.name: noindent
tex:cmd.tex:parm: raiseboxbaselineskip0pthypertargetsRegister0pt33.2.3 Register a project (before migrating the project) sRegistertextbf3.2.3 Register a project (before migrating the project)

tex:cmd.name: markright
tex:cmd.tex:parm: Register a project (before migrating the project)

tex:group: parskip .5pt plus 1pt minus 1pt XLingPapertempdimXLingPaperbulletlistitemwidth+leftskipXLingPapertempdiminterlinepenalty10000XLingPaperbulletlistitemwidth•Click the textbfRegister online buttonXLingPapertempdimXLingPaperbulletlistitemwidth+leftskipXLingPapertempdiminterlinepenalty10000XLingPaperbulletlistitemwidth•Fill in the web form. (Fields with an asterisk [red star] are required.)XLingPapertempdimXLingPaperbulletlistitemwidth+leftskipXLingPapertempdiminterlinepenalty10000XLingPaperbulletlistitemwidth•Short name: You cannot change the project short name,XLingPapertempdimXLingPaperbulletlistitemwidth+leftskipXLingPapertempdiminterlinepenalty10000XLingPaperbulletlistitemwidth•Long project name: You can change the long project name.XLingPapertempdimXLingPaperbulletlistitemwidth+leftskipXLingPapertempdiminterlinepenalty10000XLingPaperbulletlistitemwidth•Paratext 8 requires a language identifier for your language. Use the search in the language name to find the ethnologue code for your language. You can modify the language name, or use the “advanced” to specify or create additional information about the language.XLingPapertempdimXLingPaperbulletlistitemwidth+leftskipXLingPapertempdiminterlinepenalty10000XLingPaperbulletlistitemwidth•Scope refers to whether the project will be a complete Bible, or complete Bible including apocrypha, or New Testament, or some other grouping of books. You can add more books to your project scope later as this can be changed after registration.XLingPapertempdimXLingPaperbulletlistitemwidth+leftskipXLingPapertempdiminterlinepenalty10000XLingPaperbulletlistitemwidth•Translation type refers to whether it is the first translation for this language, a revision of an existing translation, or a new translation, or a translation including study materials, such as a study Bible. For a revision, you have to specify that you have permission from the rights holders of the translation you are revising.XLingPapertempdimXLingPaperbulletlistitemwidth+leftskipXLingPapertempdiminterlinepenalty10000XLingPaperbulletlistitemwidth•Specify the country where the language is spoken. You can type a few letters of the name then pick the desired country. You can specify more than one country if the language spreads across bordersXLingPapertempdimXLingPaperbulletlistitemwidth+leftskipXLingPapertempdiminterlinepenalty10000XLingPaperbulletlistitemwidth•The rights holder would be the organization you expect will have the copyright for a print edition. This too can be changed if it needs to be later on.XLingPapertempdimXLingPaperbulletlistitemwidth+leftskipXLingPapertempdiminterlinepenalty10000XLingPaperbulletlistitemwidth•The last four fields allow you to add more information if it is relevant for describing your project. (None of these are required.)XLingPapertempdimXLingPaperbulletlistitemwidth+leftskipXLingPapertempdiminterlinepenalty10000XLingPaperbulletlistitemwidth•You can mark if your project is confidential or not. Only Paratext 8 registered users can view the name of standard projects, a confidential project will be hidden even from other Paratext 8 users.XLingPapertempdimXLingPaperbulletlistitemwidth+leftskipXLingPapertempdiminterlinepenalty10000XLingPaperbulletlistitemwidth•Another option is to mark a project as a test or training project. You can use this option for test projects you create, or for projects you use for practice in a training course.XLingPapertempdimXLingPaperbulletlistitemwidth+leftskipXLingPapertempdiminterlinepenalty10000XLingPaperbulletlistitemwidth•The last requirement to register is stating that you agree to follow the FOBAI guidelines in your translation project, and you agree to store a backup copy of your project in the Digital Bible Library.

tex:cmd.name: XLingPaperblockquote
tex:cmd.tex:parm: The Digital Bible Library is a tool for making translations available online or for mobile users, but your project will not be available to anyone until you agree to make it available.

tex:group: parskip .5pt plus 1pt minus 1pt XLingPapertempdimXLingPaperbulletlistitemwidth+leftskipXLingPapertempdiminterlinepenalty10000XLingPaperbulletlistitemwidth•To submit the registration, click textbfSubmit.textitThe registry should tell you that the project registered successfully. (You may need to scroll to the top of the page to see this).

tex:cmd.name: XLingPaperblockquote
tex:cmd.tex:parm: When you are ready, go through the migration again. Clicking “Migrate later” will not cancel the project registration if you just submitted it, you can skip the registration steps and go on to migration

tex:cmd.name: noindent
tex:cmd.tex:parm: raiseboxbaselineskip0pthypertargetsMigRep0pt33.2.4 Migrating a registered projectsMigReptextbf3.2.4 Migrating a registered project

tex:group: parskip .5pt plus 1pt minus 1pt XLingPapertempdimXLingPaperbulletlistitemwidth+leftskipXLingPapertempdiminterlinepenalty10000XLingPaperbulletlistitemwidth•Go back to Paratext.textitIt should detect that the project is now registered, and inform you of that.0pt "../supimgeng/image005.png" scaled 750

parskip .5pt plus 1pt minus 1pt XLingPapertempdimXLingPaperbulletlistitemwidth+leftskipXLingPapertempdiminterlinepenalty10000XLingPaperbulletlistitemwidth•The migration step has several boxes you have to check off to verify that you understand what is involved.XLingPapertempdimXLingPaperbulletlistitemwidth+leftskipXLingPapertempdiminterlinepenalty10000XLingPaperbulletlistitemwidth•Put a textbfcheck in these boxes if they are true, then click textbfMigrate now to proceed.

tex:cmd.name: XLingPaperblockquote
tex:cmd.tex:parm: If you need to do something else before you are ready to migrate, click “Migrate Later,” and go finish your preparations.

tex:cmd.name: noindent
tex:cmd.tex:parm: raiseboxbaselineskip0pthypertargetsProjEtc0pt33.2.5 Additional Project settings sProjEtctextbf3.2.5 Additional Project settings

tex:group: parskip .5pt plus 1pt minus 1pt XLingPapertempdimXLingPaperbulletlistitemwidth+leftskipXLingPapertempdiminterlinepenalty10000XLingPaperbulletlistitemwidth•textbfLanguage identifier: After you click “Migrate now”, Paratext 8 may tell you that need to specify a language identifier for your project.

tex:cmd.name: XLingPaperblockquote
tex:cmd.tex:parm: You can verify what the language name and language identifier are for your project by going to textbfProject > textbfProject Properties and settings, and looking at the textbflanguage settings. The language identifier is in brackets after the language name.

tex:group: parskip .5pt plus 1pt minus 1pt XLingPapertempdimXLingPaperbulletlistitemwidth+leftskipXLingPapertempdiminterlinepenalty10000XLingPaperbulletlistitemwidth•textbfBooks The project properties and settings has a “Books” tab, you specify here the books that you plan to track their progress in your project.0pt "../supimgeng/image006.png" scaled 750

tex:cmd.name: XLingPaperblockquote
tex:cmd.tex:parm: You can choose book by book, or specify textbfOld Testament, textbfNew Testament, textbfDeuterocanon by using the buttons. You can change this list of books later on in the project if your plans for the project change.

tex:cmd.name: noindent
tex:cmd.tex:parm: raiseboxbaselineskip0pthypertargetsMIgNS0pt33.2.6 Migrate Non-shared projectMigrer un projet non partagésMIgNStextbf3.2.6 Migrate Non-shared projectMigrer un projet non partagé

tex:cmd.name: markright
tex:cmd.tex:parm: Migrate Non-shared projectMigrer un projet non partagé

tex:cmd.name: XLingPaperblockquote
tex:cmd.tex:parm: If a project was not shared in Paratext 7 then you do not have to register it in order to migrate.

tex:group: parskip .5pt plus 1pt minus 1pt XLingPapertempdimXLingPaperbulletlistitemwidth+leftskipXLingPapertempdiminterlinepenalty10000XLingPaperbulletlistitemwidth•textbfFile > textbfOpen ProjectXLingPapertempdimXLingPaperbulletlistitemwidth+leftskipXLingPapertempdiminterlinepenalty10000XLingPaperbulletlistitemwidth•Click ““textbfShow Paratext 7 Projects”XLingPapertempdimXLingPaperbulletlistitemwidth+leftskipXLingPapertempdiminterlinepenalty10000XLingPaperbulletlistitemwidth•Choose the desired projectXLingPapertempdimXLingPaperbulletlistitemwidth+leftskipXLingPapertempdiminterlinepenalty10000XLingPaperbulletlistitemwidth•Click textbfMigrate Now0pt "../supimgeng/image007.png" scaled 750 textitWhen you click “Migrate” the project will be migrated to the Paratext 8 folder and ready to be used. The registration status will determine what functionality exists for the project.XLingPapertempdimXLingPaperbulletlistitemwidth+leftskipXLingPapertempdiminterlinepenalty10000XLingPaperbulletlistitemwidth•Note: Non-shared projects don't have to be registered but it is recommended.

tex:cmd.name: XLingPaperblockquote
tex:cmd.tex:parm: Remember, no one should edit the project anymore in Paratext 7. That would be wasted effort as no one else will see their changes. To help your team members remember this, you could have them remove the project from their Paratext 7 once they have gotten it in Paratext 8. Or maybe they can uninstall Paratext 7 from their computer if they don't need it for other projects.

tex:cmd.name: markright
tex:cmd.tex:parm: Register for Paratext 8 (with a Google account)

tex:group: parskip .5pt plus 1pt minus 1pt XLingPapertempdimXLingPaperbulletlistitemwidth+leftskipXLingPapertempdiminterlinepenalty10000XLingPaperbulletlistitemwidth•Go to registry.paratext.org in your web browser.textitThe “Sign in” screen is displayed.XLingPapertempdimXLingPaperbulletlistitemwidth+leftskipXLingPapertempdiminterlinepenalty10000XLingPaperbulletlistitemwidth•Enter your email account.textitThe site will check if your account exists, and if it is on a Google server, you will have the choice of authenticating with Google.XLingPapertempdimXLingPaperbulletlistitemwidth+leftskipXLingPapertempdiminterlinepenalty10000XLingPaperbulletlistitemwidth•Choose to authenticate with GoogletextitA new screen is displayed asking for your password.XLingPapertempdimXLingPaperbulletlistitemwidth+leftskipXLingPapertempdiminterlinepenalty10000XLingPaperbulletlistitemwidth•Enter your textbfGoogle account password.XLingPapertempdimXLingPaperbulletlistitemwidth+leftskipXLingPapertempdiminterlinepenalty10000XLingPaperbulletlistitemwidth•Click textbfyes to authorize the Paratext site to use your profile information.textitYou are then ready to start filling in your Paratext registration.

tex:cmd.name: XLingPaperblockquote
tex:cmd.tex:parm: If you do not have a Google address see page xx)

tex:cmd.name: noindent
tex:cmd.tex:parm: raiseboxbaselineskip0pthypertargetsFillReg0pt34.2.2 Filling in the registrationsFillRegtextbf4.2.2 Filling in the registration

tex:group: parskip .5pt plus 1pt minus 1pt XLingPapertempdimXLingPaperbulletlistitemwidth+leftskipXLingPapertempdiminterlinepenalty10000XLingPaperbulletlistitemwidth•Click the appropriate circle to choose your textbfregistration type (new registration, previous Paratext 7 registration, or previous Paratext 8 registration).XLingPapertempdimXLingPaperbulletlistitemwidth+leftskipXLingPapertempdiminterlinepenalty10000XLingPaperbulletlistitemwidth•Choose your textbforganization from the list, or if you are not a member you can leave this blank.

tex:cmd.name: XLingPaperblockquote
tex:cmd.tex:parm: Anyone can register to use Paratext, but people who are not members of a translation organization and who are not members of a registered project will not be able to use all the features of Paratext and will have access to only a few resources.

tex:group: parskip .5pt plus 1pt minus 1pt XLingPapertempdimXLingPaperbulletlistitemwidth+leftskipXLingPapertempdiminterlinepenalty10000XLingPaperbulletlistitemwidth•Select your textbfcountry.XLingPapertempdimXLingPaperbulletlistitemwidth+leftskipXLingPapertempdiminterlinepenalty10000XLingPaperbulletlistitemwidth•Enter if relevant your textbffield entity and your supervisorXLingPapertempdimXLingPaperbulletlistitemwidth+leftskipXLingPapertempdiminterlinepenalty10000XLingPaperbulletlistitemwidth•Explain textbfwhy you want to use Paratext.XLingPapertempdimXLingPaperbulletlistitemwidth+leftskipXLingPapertempdiminterlinepenalty10000XLingPaperbulletlistitemwidth•Check the box at the bottom if you want to get email announcements about Paratext updates and news.XLingPapertempdimXLingPaperbulletlistitemwidth+leftskipXLingPapertempdiminterlinepenalty10000XLingPaperbulletlistitemwidth•When finished, click “textbfRegister”textitThe server will give you a code. It will also send this to your email.

tex:cmd.name: XLingPaperblockquote
tex:cmd.tex:parm: Keep that email, or to the code that is displayed here, because if you lose it, there is no way to look it up again. (This is a security feature, user codes are not stored on the server so they cannot be stolen if someone hacks onto the server)

tex:cmd.name: noindent
tex:cmd.tex:parm: raiseboxbaselineskip0pthypertargetsNonGoogle0pt34.2.3 Register for Paratext with a non-google accountsNonGoogletextbf4.2.3 Register for Paratext with a non-google account

tex:cmd.name: markright
tex:cmd.tex:parm: Register for Paratext with a non-google account

tex:group: parskip .5pt plus 1pt minus 1pt XLingPapertempdimXLingPaperbulletlistitemwidth+leftskipXLingPapertempdiminterlinepenalty10000XLingPaperbulletlistitemwidth•If your email account is not on a Google server, or if it is but you choose to not use Google to authenticate, the registry server will ask you to enter a password.

tex:cmd.name: XLingPaperblockquote
tex:cmd.tex:parm: This does not have to be your email password, you can choose a different password for your Paratext registration.

tex:group: parskip .5pt plus 1pt minus 1pt XLingPapertempdimXLingPaperbulletlistitemwidth+leftskipXLingPapertempdiminterlinepenalty10000XLingPaperbulletlistitemwidth•Enter the password you want to set upXLingPapertempdimXLingPaperbulletlistitemwidth+leftskipXLingPapertempdiminterlinepenalty10000XLingPaperbulletlistitemwidth•Enter it again as a confirmationtextitThe server will send an email to your account with a link to verify.XLingPapertempdimXLingPaperbulletlistitemwidth+leftskipXLingPapertempdiminterlinepenalty10000XLingPaperbulletlistitemwidth•Open your email, go to the link, and proceed to register for Paratext (see above).

tex:cmd.name: noindent
tex:cmd.tex:parm: raiseboxbaselineskip0pthypertargetsChangeCode0pt34.2.4 Change your Paratext codesChangeCodetextbf4.2.4 Change your Paratext code

tex:group: parskip .5pt plus 1pt minus 1pt XLingPapertempdimXLingPaperbulletlistitemwidth+leftskipXLingPapertempdiminterlinepenalty10000XLingPaperbulletlistitemwidth•Go to the registration website, registry.paratext.org.XLingPapertempdimXLingPaperbulletlistitemwidth+leftskipXLingPapertempdiminterlinepenalty10000XLingPaperbulletlistitemwidth•Log in (if you are not logged in) Log in (if you are not logged in)0pt "../supimgeng/image008.png" scaled 750XLingPapertempdimXLingPaperbulletlistitemwidth+leftskipXLingPapertempdiminterlinepenalty10000XLingPaperbulletlistitemwidth•Click on your user name at the top left.XLingPapertempdimXLingPaperbulletlistitemwidth+leftskipXLingPapertempdiminterlinepenalty10000XLingPaperbulletlistitemwidth•Click on textbfSettings.0pt "../supimgeng/image009.png" scaled 750XLingPapertempdimXLingPaperbulletlistitemwidth+leftskipXLingPapertempdiminterlinepenalty10000XLingPaperbulletlistitemwidth•Beside Paratext 8, click ‘textbfSettings”. Beside Paratext 8, click ‘textbfSettings”.textitThe registration Details screen is displayed.

parskip .5pt plus 1pt minus 1pt XLingPapertempdimXLingPaperbulletlistitemwidth+leftskipXLingPapertempdiminterlinepenalty10000XLingPaperbulletlistitemwidth•Click on the textbfGenerate button to generate a new code Click on the textbfGenerate button to generate a new code0pt "../supimgeng/image010.png" scaled 750 textitThe code will be sent to your email address.XLingPapertempdimXLingPaperbulletlistitemwidth+leftskipXLingPapertempdiminterlinepenalty10000XLingPaperbulletlistitemwidth•Start ParatexttextitIf it connects to the Internet it will detect that the old code is no longer valid, and it will ask you to update your registration info.XLingPapertempdimXLingPaperbulletlistitemwidth+leftskipXLingPapertempdiminterlinepenalty10000XLingPaperbulletlistitemwidth•Go to your email, and copy the new code.XLingPapertempdimXLingPaperbulletlistitemwidth+leftskipXLingPapertempdiminterlinepenalty10000XLingPaperbulletlistitemwidth•Go back to ParatexttextitIt may already have pasted in your new code.XLingPapertempdimXLingPaperbulletlistitemwidth+leftskipXLingPapertempdiminterlinepenalty10000XLingPaperbulletlistitemwidth•If it has not, paste in the new code into the registration form, and click OK.textitYou should be reregistered.

tex:cmd.name: XLingPaperblockquote
tex:cmd.tex:parm: You will need to do this on any other computer that you have Paratext installed on as well.

tex:group: parskip .5pt plus 1pt minus 1pt XLingPapertempdimXLingPaperbulletlistitemwidth+leftskipXLingPapertempdiminterlinepenalty10000XLingPaperbulletlistitemwidth•textbfTools > textbfRegistration Information and paste the code there.

tex:cmd.name: noindent
tex:cmd.tex:parm: raiseboxbaselineskip0pthypertargetsREGNoEmail0pt34.2.5 Register a new user (who does not have an email address)sREGNoEmailtextbf4.2.5 Register a new user (who does not have an email address)

tex:cmd.name: markright
tex:cmd.tex:parm: Register a new user (who does not have an email address)

tex:cmd.name: XLingPaperblockquote
tex:cmd.tex:parm: Any administrator of a registered project can create new user registrations if they need to add people to their project. These users do not need to have an email address.

tex:group: parskip .5pt plus 1pt minus 1pt XLingPapertempdimXLingPaperbulletlistitemwidth+leftskipXLingPapertempdiminterlinepenalty10000XLingPaperbulletlistitemwidth•Go to registry.paratext.orgXLingPapertempdimXLingPaperbulletlistitemwidth+leftskipXLingPapertempdiminterlinepenalty10000XLingPaperbulletlistitemwidth•Log in if you are not already.XLingPapertempdimXLingPaperbulletlistitemwidth+leftskipXLingPapertempdiminterlinepenalty10000XLingPaperbulletlistitemwidth•Click on textbfUsers0pt "../supimgeng/image011.png" scaled 750XLingPapertempdimXLingPaperbulletlistitemwidth+leftskipXLingPapertempdiminterlinepenalty10000XLingPaperbulletlistitemwidth•Click the textbf“+ Register new user” button.textitThe new user registration form is displayed.0pt "../supimgeng/image012.png" scaled 750XLingPapertempdimXLingPaperbulletlistitemwidth+leftskipXLingPapertempdiminterlinepenalty10000XLingPaperbulletlistitemwidth•Fill in their name, and the rest of their information.XLingPapertempdimXLingPaperbulletlistitemwidth+leftskipXLingPapertempdiminterlinepenalty10000XLingPaperbulletlistitemwidth•You do not need to supply their email address.XLingPapertempdimXLingPaperbulletlistitemwidth+leftskipXLingPapertempdiminterlinepenalty10000XLingPaperbulletlistitemwidth•**

tex:cmd.name: XLingPaperblockquote
tex:cmd.tex:parm: A user added by someone else cannot be made an administrator of a project, nor a consultant. If you would like to make someone a consultant or administrator they can register themselves for Paratext, then you can add their name to the project.

tex:group: parskip .5pt plus 1pt minus 1pt XLingPapertempdimXLingPaperbulletlistitemwidth+leftskipXLingPapertempdiminterlinepenalty10000XLingPaperbulletlistitemwidth•When competed, click “textbfCreate”textitThe server should respond by e-mailing you the user code for the new user.XLingPapertempdimXLingPaperbulletlistitemwidth+leftskipXLingPapertempdiminterlinepenalty10000XLingPaperbulletlistitemwidth•**

tex:cmd.name: XLingPaperblockquote
tex:cmd.tex:parm: Hang onto this code, because it cannot be recovered again if you lose it.

tex:cmd.name: noindent
tex:cmd.tex:parm: raiseboxbaselineskip0pthypertargetsREGIndiv0pt34.2.6 Translation project by an unrecognised individual/organisationsREGIndivtextbf4.2.6 Translation project by an unrecognised individual/organisation

tex:cmd.name: markright
tex:cmd.tex:parm: Translation project by an unrecognised individual/organisation

tex:group: parskip .5pt plus 1pt minus 1pt XLingPapertempdimXLingPaperbulletlistitemwidth+leftskipXLingPapertempdiminterlinepenalty10000XLingPaperbulletlistitemwidth•If a translator is not part of a recognised organisation, she can apply to the BoG (boardofgovernors@paratext.org) to be members of "Independent Translators" pseudo organization

tex:cmd.name: XLingPaperblockquote
tex:cmd.tex:parm: It is unclear how many text resource owners will grant access to this group

tex:cmd.name: LARGE

tex:cmd.name: noindent

tex:cmd.name: noindent

tex:cmd.name: noindent

tex:cmd.tex:parm: What are you going to do?

tex:cmd.name: noindent
tex:cmd.tex:parm: raiseboxbaselineskip0pthypertargetsCPStart0pt35.2.1 Create a new project sCPStarttextbf5.2.1 Create a new project

tex:group: parskip .5pt plus 1pt minus 1pt XLingPapertempdimXLingPaperbulletlistitemwidth+leftskipXLingPapertempdiminterlinepenalty10000XLingPaperbulletlistitemwidth•textbfFile > textbfNew ProjecttextitThe New project dialog is displayed.0pt "../supimgeng/image013.png" scaled 750

tex:cmd.name: noindent
tex:cmd.tex:parm: raiseboxbaselineskip0pthypertargetsCPName0pt35.2.2 Name for the projectsCPNametextbf5.2.2 Name for the project

tex:group: parskip .5pt plus 1pt minus 1pt XLingPapertempdimXLingPaperbulletlistitemwidth+leftskipXLingPapertempdiminterlinepenalty10000XLingPaperbulletlistitemwidth•Click the textbfEdit button0pt "../supimgeng/image014.png" scaled 750 textitThe “edit name” dialog is displayed

parskip .5pt plus 1pt minus 1pt XLingPapertempdimXLingPaperbulletlistitemwidth+leftskipXLingPapertempdiminterlinepenalty10000XLingPaperbulletlistitemwidth•In the name section, give the project a name and a matching short name.

tex:cmd.name: XLingPaperblockquote
tex:cmd.tex:parm: Once you create a project name, the short name cannot be changed, because this is the name Paratext will give to the folder containing the project files, and also the name given to the project on the Internet server.

tex:group: parskip .5pt plus 1pt minus 1pt XLingPapertempdimXLingPaperbulletlistitemwidth+leftskipXLingPapertempdiminterlinepenalty10000XLingPaperbulletlistitemwidth•If you have another Paratext project in the same language, you can just pick the language from the list in Paratext [2]. If not, you will need to create a new language.XLingPapertempdimXLingPaperbulletlistitemwidth+leftskipXLingPapertempdiminterlinepenalty10000XLingPaperbulletlistitemwidth•Click on textbfNew0pt "../supimgeng/image016.png" scaled 750 textitThe Choose language identifier box is displayed.XLingPapertempdimXLingPaperbulletlistitemwidth+leftskipXLingPapertempdiminterlinepenalty10000XLingPaperbulletlistitemwidth•La boîte de dialogue textbfChoose Language Identifier (choisir l’identifiant de la langue) s’affiche..

parskip .5pt plus 1pt minus 1pt XLingPapertempdimXLingPaperbulletlistitemwidth+leftskipXLingPapertempdiminterlinepenalty10000XLingPaperbulletlistitemwidth•Click in the textbfSearch boxXLingPapertempdimXLingPaperbulletlistitemwidth+leftskipXLingPapertempdiminterlinepenalty10000XLingPaperbulletlistitemwidth•Start typing the name of your languagetextitParatext will display matching names.XLingPapertempdimXLingPaperbulletlistitemwidth+leftskipXLingPapertempdiminterlinepenalty10000XLingPaperbulletlistitemwidth•Click on your language in the list.textitParatext will add the language name.XLingPapertempdimXLingPaperbulletlistitemwidth+leftskipXLingPapertempdiminterlinepenalty10000XLingPaperbulletlistitemwidth•Click textbfOK.

tex:cmd.name: XLingPaperblockquote
tex:cmd.tex:parm: You can also specify additional information if needed in the “advanced” section of the language settings dialog.

tex:cmd.name: noindent
tex:cmd.tex:parm: raiseboxbaselineskip0pthypertargetsCPType0pt35.2.4 Type of projectsCPTypetextbf5.2.4 Type of project

tex:group: parskip .5pt plus 1pt minus 1pt XLingPapertempdimXLingPaperbulletlistitemwidth+leftskipXLingPapertempdiminterlinepenalty10000XLingPaperbulletlistitemwidth•Click the drop-down list beside “Type of Project”

parskip .5pt plus 1pt minus 1pt XLingPapertempdimXLingPaperbulletlistitemwidth+leftskipXLingPapertempdiminterlinepenalty10000XLingPaperbulletlistitemwidth•Choose the appropriate type for your project.

tex:cmd.name: XLingPaperblockquote
tex:cmd.tex:parm: If it is a back translation, or a daughter or transliteration project, you will need to define the source.

tex:cmd.name: noindent
tex:cmd.tex:parm: raiseboxbaselineskip0pthypertargetsCPRegNewProj0pt35.2.5 Register the new project sCPRegNewProjtextbf5.2.5 Register the new project

tex:group: parskip .5pt plus 1pt minus 1pt XLingPapertempdimXLingPaperbulletlistitemwidth+leftskipXLingPapertempdiminterlinepenalty10000XLingPaperbulletlistitemwidth•Make sure you have given the project a name and chosen the project type.XLingPapertempdimXLingPaperbulletlistitemwidth+leftskipXLingPapertempdiminterlinepenalty10000XLingPaperbulletlistitemwidth•Click textbfRegister online to go to the registration pageXLingPapertempdimXLingPaperbulletlistitemwidth+leftskipXLingPapertempdiminterlinepenalty10000XLingPaperbulletlistitemwidth•Fill in the information (see above)XLingPapertempdimXLingPaperbulletlistitemwidth+leftskipXLingPapertempdiminterlinepenalty10000XLingPaperbulletlistitemwidth•Click textbfRegister to submit.textitParatext should "automagically" detect that the project is now registered,XLingPapertempdimXLingPaperbulletlistitemwidth+leftskipXLingPapertempdiminterlinepenalty10000XLingPaperbulletlistitemwidth•Click textbfOK to create the new project.

tex:cmd.name: noindent
tex:cmd.tex:parm: raiseboxbaselineskip0pthypertargetsCPEdReg0pt35.2.6 Editing your registration sCPEdRegtextbf5.2.6 Editing your registration

tex:group: parskip .5pt plus 1pt minus 1pt XLingPapertempdimXLingPaperbulletlistitemwidth+leftskipXLingPapertempdiminterlinepenalty10000XLingPaperbulletlistitemwidth•From Paratext, make sure you are connected to the Internet,XLingPapertempdimXLingPaperbulletlistitemwidth+leftskipXLingPapertempdiminterlinepenalty10000XLingPaperbulletlistitemwidth•textbfProject > Project Properties and settingsXLingPapertempdimXLingPaperbulletlistitemwidth+leftskipXLingPapertempdiminterlinepenalty10000XLingPaperbulletlistitemwidth•Click the “textbfManage registration” link.textitThis will bring up the project registration info and you can edit it. Any project administrator can edit the registration info.

tex:group: parskip .5pt plus 1pt minus 1pt XLingPapertempdimXLingPaperbulletlistitemwidth+leftskipXLingPapertempdiminterlinepenalty10000XLingPaperbulletlistitemwidth•From the textbfFile menu, choose textbfDownload/Install resources.textitA dialogue box is displayed

parskip .5pt plus 1pt minus 1pt XLingPapertempdimXLingPaperbulletlistitemwidth+leftskipXLingPapertempdiminterlinepenalty10000XLingPaperbulletlistitemwidth•Make sure Internet has been chosen.XLingPapertempdimXLingPaperbulletlistitemwidth+leftskipXLingPapertempdiminterlinepenalty10000XLingPaperbulletlistitemwidth•Click the check boxes to the left of the desired resources.XLingPapertempdimXLingPaperbulletlistitemwidth+leftskipXLingPapertempdiminterlinepenalty10000XLingPaperbulletlistitemwidth•Click textbfDownload/Install

tex:cmd.tex:parm: What are you going to do?

tex:group: parskip .5pt plus 1pt minus 1pt XLingPapertempdimXLingPaperbulletlistitemwidth+leftskipXLingPapertempdiminterlinepenalty10000XLingPaperbulletlistitemwidth•Add the organizational base plan to the project (remove an old plan if necessary)XLingPapertempdimXLingPaperbulletlistitemwidth+leftskipXLingPapertempdiminterlinepenalty10000XLingPaperbulletlistitemwidth•Customize the plan for the team by adding/deleting and moving tasksXLingPapertempdimXLingPaperbulletlistitemwidth+leftskipXLingPapertempdiminterlinepenalty10000XLingPaperbulletlistitemwidth•Assign the tasks to the various team members.

tex:cmd.name: noindent
tex:cmd.tex:parm: raiseboxbaselineskip0pthypertargetsPP1AddPlan0pt37.2.1 Add the organisational base plansPP1AddPlantextbf7.2.1 Add the organisational base plan

tex:cmd.name: XLingPaperblockquote
tex:cmd.tex:parm: If you have an existing plan, you need to remove that plan before you can add another plan. (See below for instructions.)

tex:cmd.name: XLingPaperblockquote
tex:cmd.tex:parm: Si vous aviez un plan déjà, il faut supprimer ce plan avant d’ajouter un autre. (Voir la page suivante pour les instructions de supprimer un plan.)

tex:group: parskip .5pt plus 1pt minus 1pt XLingPapertempdimXLingPaperbulletlistitemwidth+leftskipXLingPapertempdiminterlinepenalty10000XLingPaperbulletlistitemwidth•textbfProjecttextbf> Project plan settingsXLingPapertempdimXLingPaperbulletlistitemwidth+leftskipXLingPapertempdiminterlinepenalty10000XLingPaperbulletlistitemwidth•Click textbfManage plansXLingPapertempdimXLingPaperbulletlistitemwidth+leftskipXLingPapertempdiminterlinepenalty10000XLingPaperbulletlistitemwidth•Click below textbfShow Base Plan0pt "../supimgeng/image020.png" scaled 750XLingPapertempdimXLingPaperbulletlistitemwidth+leftskipXLingPapertempdiminterlinepenalty10000XLingPaperbulletlistitemwidth•Choose your organisational base planXLingPapertempdimXLingPaperbulletlistitemwidth+leftskipXLingPapertempdiminterlinepenalty10000XLingPaperbulletlistitemwidth•Click the textbfCopy Plan arrow.0pt "../supimgeng/image021.png" scaled 750XLingPapertempdimXLingPaperbulletlistitemwidth+leftskipXLingPapertempdiminterlinepenalty10000XLingPaperbulletlistitemwidth•Click textbfOK.textitThe plan and its tasks are added to the project.

tex:cmd.name: noindent
tex:cmd.tex:parm: raiseboxbaselineskip0pthypertargetsPP1RemPlan0pt37.2.2 Remove current plan (if necessary)sPP1RemPlantextbf7.2.2 Remove current plan (if necessary)

tex:cmd.name: XLingPaperblockquote
tex:cmd.tex:parm: If the project has an old plan, you need to delete each of the current stages before adding a new base plan.

tex:group: parskip .5pt plus 1pt minus 1pt XLingPapertempdimXLingPaperbulletlistitemwidth+leftskipXLingPapertempdiminterlinepenalty10000XLingPaperbulletlistitemwidth•textbf[Projecttextbf> Project plan settingsXLingPapertempdimXLingPaperbulletlistitemwidth+leftskipXLingPapertempdiminterlinepenalty10000XLingPaperbulletlistitemwidth•Click textbfManage plans]XLingPapertempdimXLingPaperbulletlistitemwidth+leftskipXLingPapertempdiminterlinepenalty10000XLingPaperbulletlistitemwidth•Click on the last stage0pt "../supimgeng/image022.png" scaled 750

parskip .5pt plus 1pt minus 1pt XLingPapertempdimXLingPaperbulletlistitemwidth+leftskipXLingPapertempdiminterlinepenalty10000XLingPaperbulletlistitemwidth•***Click the X to remove the stageXLingPapertempdimXLingPaperbulletlistitemwidth+leftskipXLingPapertempdiminterlinepenalty10000XLingPaperbulletlistitemwidth•Confirm you want to modify the plan.XLingPapertempdimXLingPaperbulletlistitemwidth+leftskipXLingPapertempdiminterlinepenalty10000XLingPaperbulletlistitemwidth•Confirm you want to delete the stage.XLingPapertempdimXLingPaperbulletlistitemwidth+leftskipXLingPapertempdiminterlinepenalty10000XLingPaperbulletlistitemwidth•Repeat for remaining stagesXLingPapertempdimXLingPaperbulletlistitemwidth+leftskipXLingPapertempdiminterlinepenalty10000XLingPaperbulletlistitemwidth•Add the new plan (see above)

tex:cmd.tex:parm: Configure – assigning checks to a stage

tex:group: parskip .5pt plus 1pt minus 1pt XLingPapertempdimXLingPaperbulletlistitemwidth+leftskipXLingPapertempdiminterlinepenalty10000XLingPaperbulletlistitemwidth•From the textbfProject menu, choose textbfProject planXLingPapertempdimXLingPaperbulletlistitemwidth+leftskipXLingPapertempdiminterlinepenalty10000XLingPaperbulletlistitemwidth•Click on the textbfChecks tab0pt "../supimgeng/image023.png" scaled 750XLingPapertempdimXLingPaperbulletlistitemwidth+leftskipXLingPapertempdiminterlinepenalty10000XLingPaperbulletlistitemwidth•For the desired check, drop down the list0pt "../supimgeng/image024.png" scaled 750XLingPapertempdimXLingPaperbulletlistitemwidth+leftskipXLingPapertempdiminterlinepenalty10000XLingPaperbulletlistitemwidth•Choose the new stage or *none*

tex:cmd.name: markright
tex:cmd.tex:parm: Configure - Reordering tasks / Move tasks to another stage

tex:cmd.name: XLingPaperblockquote
tex:cmd.tex:parm: It is possible to reorder tasks and even move tasks to another stage. However, not all organisations permit this.

tex:group: parskip .5pt plus 1pt minus 1pt XLingPapertempdimXLingPaperbulletlistitemwidth+leftskipXLingPapertempdiminterlinepenalty10000XLingPaperbulletlistitemwidth•From the textbfProject menu, choose textbfProject PlanXLingPapertempdimXLingPaperbulletlistitemwidth+leftskipXLingPapertempdiminterlinepenalty10000XLingPaperbulletlistitemwidth•Click the textbfStages / Tasks tab.XLingPapertempdimXLingPaperbulletlistitemwidth+leftskipXLingPapertempdiminterlinepenalty10000XLingPaperbulletlistitemwidth•Select the task you want to move.XLingPapertempdimXLingPaperbulletlistitemwidth+leftskipXLingPapertempdiminterlinepenalty10000XLingPaperbulletlistitemwidth•Click the up arrow or the down arrow to move the task to a different point with respect to the other tasks, or to move it to a different stage.textitYou may get a messages asking to confirm.XLingPapertempdimXLingPaperbulletlistitemwidth+leftskipXLingPapertempdiminterlinepenalty10000XLingPaperbulletlistitemwidth•Click textbfOK.

tex:cmd.tex:parm: Copy a task from one project to another

tex:cmd.name: XLingPaperblockquote
tex:cmd.tex:parm: Note: Follow the steps below to copy a task from the project plan for project ORIG (the "origin project") to the project plan for project DEST (the "destination project").

tex:group: parskip .5pt plus 1pt minus 1pt XLingPapertempdimXLingPapersingledigitlistitemwidth+leftskipXLingPapertempdiminterlinepenalty10000XLingPapersingledigitlistitemwidth1.From the textbfFile menu, select textbfOpen Project/Resource.XLingPapertempdimXLingPapersingledigitlistitemwidth+leftskipXLingPapertempdiminterlinepenalty10000XLingPapersingledigitlistitemwidth2.Select project DEST and click textbfOK.XLingPapertempdimXLingPapersingledigitlistitemwidth+leftskipXLingPapertempdiminterlinepenalty10000XLingPapersingledigitlistitemwidth3.From the textbfProject menu, select textbfProject Plan....XLingPapertempdimXLingPapersingledigitlistitemwidth+leftskipXLingPapertempdiminterlinepenalty10000XLingPapersingledigitlistitemwidth4.At the upper right of the dialog, clicktextbftextbfManage Plans...textbf.XLingPapertempdimXLingPapersingledigitlistitemwidth+leftskipXLingPapertempdiminterlinepenalty10000XLingPapersingledigitlistitemwidth5.From the textbf"Show Base Plan" drop-down, select the project plan for the ORIG project.XLingPapertempdimXLingPapersingledigitlistitemwidth+leftskipXLingPapertempdiminterlinepenalty10000XLingPapersingledigitlistitemwidth6.On the Current Plan side of the dialog (the DEST project side), click the row that has the task which you want to precede the added task. If you want the added task to be the first task in the stage, select the stage name.XLingPapertempdimXLingPapersingledigitlistitemwidth+leftskipXLingPapertempdiminterlinepenalty10000XLingPapersingledigitlistitemwidth7.On the Base Plan side of the dialog (the ORIG project side), hover over the task you want to add and click the solid arrow that appears.

parskip .5pt plus 1pt minus 1pt XLingPapertempdimXLingPaperbulletlistitemwidth+leftskipXLingPapertempdiminterlinepenalty10000XLingPaperbulletlistitemwidth•Optional: To move the task, click the up arrow or the down arrow that appears when you hover over a task on the Current Plan side of the dialog.XLingPapertempdimXLingPaperbulletlistitemwidth+leftskipXLingPapertempdiminterlinepenalty10000XLingPaperbulletlistitemwidth•Click OK to close the "Manage Plans" dialog.XLingPapertempdimXLingPaperbulletlistitemwidth+leftskipXLingPapertempdiminterlinepenalty10000XLingPaperbulletlistitemwidth•Click OK to close the "Project Plan" dialog.textitThe copied task has the same name and progress rate as it had in the project plan for project ORIG.

tex:cmd.name: XLingPaperblockquote
tex:cmd.tex:parm: For projects that have already completed a number of stages at the time of switching to Paratext 8 the Tasks table view and/or the Stage table view of Assignments and Progress can be helpful in marking multiple books, stages or tasks, complete.

tex:group: parskip .5pt plus 1pt minus 1pt XLingPapertempdimXLingPaperbulletlistitemwidth+leftskipXLingPapertempdiminterlinepenalty10000XLingPaperbulletlistitemwidth•Click on your project.XLingPapertempdimXLingPaperbulletlistitemwidth+leftskipXLingPapertempdiminterlinepenalty10000XLingPaperbulletlistitemwidth•From the textbfProject menu, choose textbfAssignments and Progress.XLingPapertempdimXLingPaperbulletlistitemwidth+leftskipXLingPapertempdiminterlinepenalty10000XLingPaperbulletlistitemwidth•Choose Stages table view.0pt "../supimgeng/image027.png" scaled 750XLingPapertempdimXLingPaperbulletlistitemwidth+leftskipXLingPapertempdiminterlinepenalty10000XLingPaperbulletlistitemwidth•Check the box for the stages of each book as appropriate.textitThe stage will be marked as complete unless errors have been found. The errors must be corrected before the stage can be marked as completed.

tex:cmd.name: XLingPaperblockquote
tex:cmd.tex:parm: Paratext 8 will likely find errors for most older projects since new checks have been added.

tex:group: parskip .5pt plus 1pt minus 1pt XLingPapertempdimXLingPaperbulletlistitemwidth+leftskipXLingPapertempdiminterlinepenalty10000XLingPaperbulletlistitemwidth•When a project is brand new there aren’t a log of settings that can be fixed in concrete.XLingPapertempdimXLingPaperbulletlistitemwidth+leftskipXLingPapertempdiminterlinepenalty10000XLingPaperbulletlistitemwidth•As the project matures some of the inventories begin to make sense.textitWho is working on the project?XLingPapertempdimXLingPaperbulletlistitemwidth+leftskipXLingPapertempdiminterlinepenalty10000XLingPaperbulletlistitemwidth•Setup the Users, Roles and PermissionsXLingPapertempdimXLingPaperbulletlistitemwidth+leftskipXLingPapertempdiminterlinepenalty10000XLingPaperbulletlistitemwidth•Would it be helpful to have a “Simplified Menu”?textitDo you need to customize the settings?XLingPapertempdimXLingPaperbulletlistitemwidth+leftskipXLingPapertempdiminterlinepenalty10000XLingPaperbulletlistitemwidth•custom.styXLingPapertempdimXLingPaperbulletlistitemwidth+leftskipXLingPapertempdiminterlinepenalty10000XLingPaperbulletlistitemwidth•change settings of the stylesheetXLingPapertempdimXLingPaperbulletlistitemwidth+leftskipXLingPapertempdiminterlinepenalty10000XLingPaperbulletlistitemwidth•names of markers (in other languages)XLingPapertempdimXLingPaperbulletlistitemwidth+leftskipXLingPapertempdiminterlinepenalty10000XLingPaperbulletlistitemwidth•colour to help identify features?XLingPapertempdimXLingPaperbulletlistitemwidth+leftskipXLingPapertempdiminterlinepenalty10000XLingPaperbulletlistitemwidth•custom.vrsXLingPapertempdimXLingPaperbulletlistitemwidth+leftskipXLingPapertempdiminterlinepenalty10000XLingPaperbulletlistitemwidth•identify verses that are different from default versification

parskip .5pt plus 1pt minus 1pt XLingPapertempdimXLingPaperbulletlistitemwidth+leftskipXLingPapertempdiminterlinepenalty10000XLingPaperbulletlistitemwidth•Put the orthography in the language settings.XLingPapertempdimXLingPaperbulletlistitemwidth+leftskipXLingPapertempdiminterlinepenalty10000XLingPaperbulletlistitemwidth•(Keep in mind that what you put in the language settings could be going to the “Speech and Language Data Repository”

parskip .5pt plus 1pt minus 1pt XLingPapertempdimXLingPaperbulletlistitemwidth+leftskipXLingPapertempdiminterlinepenalty10000XLingPaperbulletlistitemwidth•Keyman/MSKLCXLingPapertempdimXLingPaperbulletlistitemwidth+leftskipXLingPapertempdiminterlinepenalty10000XLingPaperbulletlistitemwidth•AutoCorrect.txt

tex:group: parskip .5pt plus 1pt minus 1pt XLingPapertempdimXLingPaperbulletlistitemwidth+leftskipXLingPapertempdiminterlinepenalty10000XLingPaperbulletlistitemwidth•Open the model text.XLingPapertempdimXLingPaperbulletlistitemwidth+leftskipXLingPapertempdiminterlinepenalty10000XLingPaperbulletlistitemwidth•From the textbfInsert menu, choose textbfCross references then textbfExtract cross referencesXLingPapertempdimXLingPaperbulletlistitemwidth+leftskipXLingPapertempdiminterlinepenalty10000XLingPaperbulletlistitemwidth•Type a filenameXLingPapertempdimXLingPaperbulletlistitemwidth+leftskipXLingPapertempdiminterlinepenalty10000XLingPaperbulletlistitemwidth•Cliquez sur textbfOK.textitNote: Resource texts may not allow you to extract cross references.

tex:group: parskip .5pt plus 1pt minus 1pt XLingPapertempdimXLingPaperbulletlistitemwidth+leftskipXLingPapertempdiminterlinepenalty10000XLingPaperbulletlistitemwidth•From the textbfProject menu, select textbfScripture Reference Settings.XLingPapertempdimXLingPaperbulletlistitemwidth+leftskipXLingPapertempdiminterlinepenalty10000XLingPaperbulletlistitemwidth•Verify that the following have been correctly defined for your project (edit them if necessary):XLingPapertempdimXLingPaperbulletlistitemwidth+leftskipXLingPapertempdiminterlinepenalty10000XLingPaperbulletlistitemwidth•The punctuation on the Reference Format tab.XLingPapertempdimXLingPaperbulletlistitemwidth+leftskipXLingPapertempdiminterlinepenalty10000XLingPaperbulletlistitemwidth•The book abbreviations on the Book Names tab.XLingPapertempdimXLingPaperbulletlistitemwidth+leftskipXLingPapertempdiminterlinepenalty10000XLingPaperbulletlistitemwidth•Click textbfOK.

tex:group: parskip .5pt plus 1pt minus 1pt XLingPapertempdimXLingPaperbulletlistitemwidth+leftskipXLingPapertempdiminterlinepenalty10000XLingPaperbulletlistitemwidth•From the textbfProject menu, select textbfLanguage Settings …XLingPapertempdimXLingPaperbulletlistitemwidth+leftskipXLingPapertempdiminterlinepenalty10000XLingPaperbulletlistitemwidth•Click the textbfOther Characters tab.XLingPapertempdimXLingPaperbulletlistitemwidth+leftskipXLingPapertempdiminterlinepenalty10000XLingPaperbulletlistitemwidth•In the textbfVerse segment characters box, enter at least six different characters separated by spaces.XLingPapertempdimXLingPaperbulletlistitemwidth+leftskipXLingPapertempdiminterlinepenalty10000XLingPaperbulletlistitemwidth•Click textbfOK.

tex:group: parskip .5pt plus 1pt minus 1pt XLingPapertempdimXLingPaperbulletlistitemwidth+leftskipXLingPapertempdiminterlinepenalty10000XLingPaperbulletlistitemwidth•From the textbfTools menu, point to textbfCross References, and then select textbfInsert Cross References.XLingPapertempdimXLingPaperbulletlistitemwidth+leftskipXLingPapertempdiminterlinepenalty10000XLingPaperbulletlistitemwidth•Click textbfBrowse....XLingPapertempdimXLingPaperbulletlistitemwidth+leftskipXLingPapertempdiminterlinepenalty10000XLingPaperbulletlistitemwidth•Find the .xrf file of extracted cross references.XLingPapertempdimXLingPaperbulletlistitemwidth+leftskipXLingPapertempdiminterlinepenalty10000XLingPaperbulletlistitemwidth•Select the file, and click textbfOpen.XLingPapertempdimXLingPaperbulletlistitemwidth+leftskipXLingPapertempdiminterlinepenalty10000XLingPaperbulletlistitemwidth•If desired, select one or more of the options:

parskip .5pt plus 1pt minus 1pt XLingPapertempdimXLingPaperbulletlistitemwidth+leftskipXLingPapertempdiminterlinepenalty10000XLingPaperbulletlistitemwidth•Click textbfOKtextitIf the Copyright box displays a copyright notice or required statement of acknowledgments, copy the text, and then paste it wherever you keep this kind of information for the project.
